text: Put a bridle on thy tongue set a guard before thy lips, lest the words of thine own mouth destroy thy peace... on much speaking cometh repentance, but in silence is safety.
author: William Drummond

text: In fact, because of this deep desire for peace, the ruling class leaders of this land, from 1945 on, stepped up the hysteria and propaganda to drive into American minds the false notion that danger threatened them from the East.
author: Paul Robeson

text: Many African leaders refuse to send their troops on peace keeping missions abroad because they probably need their armies to intimidate their own populations.
author: Kofi Annan

text: We would fight not for the political future of a distant city, rather for principles whose destruction would ruin the possibility of peace and security for the peoples of the earth.
author: Neville Chamberlain

text: We love peace, but not peace at any price.
author: Douglas William Jerrold
